means: 马达，发动机，[火箭]助推器

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"机器，装置"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: machine, machinery, mechanism, apparatus, engine, motor
means: machine ： 普通用词，泛指一切机器。
mechanism ： 指运行系统，简单的机械装置。
apparatus ： 指具有特殊用途的装置。
engine ： 既可泛指或大或小、简单或复杂的机械、机器，又可指产生动力的发动机或引擎。
motor ： 通常指小型或轻型马达、发动机。

word_mean: 运动原：指肌肉、运动神经或其中枢，能影响运动或产生运动

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting a person who imparts motion): from Latin, literally mover', based on movere 'to move'. The current sense of the noun dates from the mid 19th cent

entry.def: The motor in a machine, vehicle, or boat is the part that uses electricity or fuel to produce movement, so that the machine, vehicle, or boat can work.

example.ex: She got in and started the motor.

entry.tran: 机动的;由发动机驱动的
entry.def: Motor vehicles and boats have a petrol or diesel engine.

example.ex: Theft of motor vehicles is up by 15.9%.
example.tran: 机动车辆偷盗案上升了15.9%。

entry.def: Motor is used to describe activities relating to vehicles such as cars and buses.

example.ex: ...the future of the British motor industry...
He worked as a motor mechanic.

entry.def: Some people refer to a car as a motor .
If you motor somewhere, you travel there in a car, usually for pleasure.

example.ex: I had motored down from Cheshire.
example.tran: 我从柴郡一路南下开过来。

entry.def: If people in a small sailing boat motor somewhere, they use the boat's motor rather than the power of the wind to get there.

example.ex: Restarting the engine, we motored downriver.
example.tran: 我们重新启动马达，沿河而下。

means.word_mean: 1. machine that converts other forms of energy into mechanical energy and so imparts motion
2. a nonspecific agent that imparts motion;

sentences.sentence: "happiness is the aim of all men and the motor of all action"

means.word_mean: 1. travel or be transported in a vehicle;

sentences.sentence: "We drove to the university every morning"
"They motored to London for the theater"

means.word_mean: 1. conveying information to the muscles from the CNS;
2. causing or able to cause motion;

stems_affixes.word_buile: mot运动+ive……的→n.动机,目的 adj.发动的,运动的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 远的,遥远的,疏远的,偏僻的,细微的
stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+mot运动+e→动回去→退回去→遥远的
com共同+motion动→大家一起动→动乱
mot运动+ion表名词→n.运动,动;提议,动议
mot运动+ive……的→n.动机,目的 adj.发动的,运动的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 发动机, 电动机,汽车
stems_affixes.word_buile: mot运动+or物器→n.发动机, 电动机,汽车
motor汽车+cycle=cycl圆,环→圆,环[轮胎]占大部分的车→摩托车, 机车
promote[v.促进;提升]+ion表名词→n.促进;提升;创立

stems_affixes.value_cn: [美口]夸张地作为, 表现感情
促动;激励,鼓励,作为……的动机
stems_affixes.word_buile: motive动机,目的+ate表动词→motivate使有动机→推动

Sentence.sentence: Today's presentation will show how we see the development of the motor car in the short to medium term, and that is why we have invited all of you here today.
Trends for the development of the motor car
They can match conventional motor cars in performance and safety.
When the Ford Motor Company, for example, recently announced that it was bringing some production home, the White House cheered.
A recent study shows that meat consumption is one of the main ways that human can damage the environment, second only to the use of motor vehicles.
The 500 UK motors workers who had been on strike in High Town for the past 3 three weeks went back to work this morning.

sentences.en: A washing machine is run by a small electric motor.
sentences.cn: 洗衣机由一台小电动机驱动。

sentences.en: We motored over to Cambridge to see some friends.
sentences.cn: 我们开车去剑桥看一些朋友。

sentences.en: The foreign guests were motored from the airfield to the hotel.
sentences.cn: 用车把外宾从机场送到旅馆。

jushi.chinese: 这架飞机有两台发动机。

jushi.english: This lawn mower is driven by a small electric motor.
jushi.chinese: 这割草机是由一台小型电动机驱动的。

jushi.english: A washing-machine has an electric motor.
